answers.answer: What's the temperature?  Different people have different "normal" temps.  How do you take it?  Is it varying just by a degree or two?

Hi, I  too, went around 10 years with simular symptoms. I went to the doctors monthly, but nothing. After awhile I just figured this was my normal. I spent a lot of time in bed as I was so tired all the time. My body temp was up and down. Sometimes I would even sweat sooo much I would have to change my clothes as they were soaked. Anyways, about a year ago I was finally diagnosed with diabetes. I was like WHAT. I was shocked as I had been going to the doctor for such a long time and why did they not find it before. Diabetes is sooo common and extremely easy to diagnose. At the same time I was so extremely happy as this wasn't my normal and I could do a lot to get better. Thats just part of my story, so if they haven't checked you for diabetes it is a very easy blood test, I would recommend it.good luck josse722

question: Hello Sir,I'm suffering from low grade fever for 10 years,I have visited many doctors but no use.Main symptoms I’m having1. Body temperature high then normal2. Knee pains3. tiredness4. Urinating frequently5. Body pains6. Body temperature too high on early morning7. cold and coughAfter taking some antibiotics i removed from cold and cough but not from low grade fever.please help to recover me.Regards,Himananda
title: low grade fever for years
